Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Homer -- 1% Tax Rededication - Mayor & BOS - Perp
Race.SummaryText:
Town of Homer Proposition
(Rededication of Existing 1.0% Sales Tax)
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Homer, Parish of Claiborne, State of Louisiana (the "Town") be authorized to rededicate the proceeds received by the Town from the levy and collection of a tax of one percent (1.0%) (the "Tax") currently being levied in the Town as authorized at an election held on July 27, 1971, for an infinite period (an estimated $505,000 reasonably expected to be collected from the first year following rededication) so that the proceeds (after paying costs of collecting and administering the Tax), be used for the purposes of improving and/or maintaining public works of the Town, including streets and related drainage, combined sewer and waterworks system, garbage collection and waste disposal facilities, police department stations and equipment, public buildings and/or fire department stations and equipment, including fire engines, public parks and recreational facilities, airport facilities; and purchasing and acquiring the necessary land, equipment and furnishings for the aforesaid public works, title to which improvements shall be in the public, or for any one or more of said purposes, and for further authority to fund a portion of the avails of the Tax into Bonds in the manner provided by law?
